entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:48AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM TO BRING GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A strong area of low pressure (982 mb) in the North Pacific will arrive over the Alaska Peninsula Saturday afternoon. The front associated with this low will lift northward and extend across the northern Gulf coast from Kodiak Island to Prince William Sound.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kodiak Island; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 12:41AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Sag River Causing Erosion Along the Dalton Highway... The Sagavanirktok River is currently flowing out of its bank due to remnant ice in the main channel. This is forcing the water over its bank to the west and causing erosion along the Dalton Highway near milepost 403. These conditions are expected to persist until ice in the main channel clears. Elevated flows are expected

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 12:41AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Moderate Rainfall Causing Potential River Rises... Moderate to heavy rain showers will continue through Saturday morning. Periods of rain will result in an area of 0.5 to 1.00 inches of additional accumulations in the Eastern Brooks Range. This rain may cause minor rises in rivers and streams draining the Brooks Range. At this point, significant impacts are not expected.
